title: Mapping Magnetic Field by Retrieving and Refining the Center Position of Non-uniform Diffraction Disks in Lorentz 4D-STEM
content: Recent development in scanning transmission electron microscopy (STEM) allows the use of 4D-STEM, a technique that captures an electron diffraction pattern at each scanning point in STEM, to measure magnetic field in materials. Compared to conventional Lorentz TEM with Transport-of-Intensity equation (TIE) and off-axis electron holography, 4D-STEM can achieve better spatial resolution. The key to obtain high quality magnetic field mapping is to accurately determine the position of the central disk in a 4D-STEM pattern, which is very challenging, especially in the presence of complex diffraction contrast within the disk. Here, we propose a robust procedure by refining the peak shape and position of the Circular Hough Transformed diffraction disk to accurately determine the central disk position for magnetic field mapping [1].
